snippet: SCHWARTZ GOODMAN-- Edith, 93, of NYC, died April 12, 2016. Edith was born to the late Emmanuel Schwartz and Sarah Doctorow Schwartz of Pelham, NY. She received her BA from Wheaton College, MAs from Columbia and Yeshiva, and PhD from NYU. Edith was a successful psychoanalyst and clinical supervisor for 40+ years on the Upper West Side. Admired by colleagues and students, she was an active member of the Institute for Psychoanalytic Training and Research and the New York Freudian Society. A devoted and loving wife, mother, grandmother, aunt, friend, and animal lover, Edith had a brilliant mind, adored her work, and was passionate about helping people. Survived by stepdaughter Shelley Goodman Morofsky, stepson Robert Goodman Kahn (and wife Karen), and daughter-in-law Antonia Goodman. Predeceased by her beloved husband Sol Goodman, stepson Stephen Goodman, son-in- law Allan Morofsky, and brothers Daniel and Robert Schwartz. A memorial service is planned, details on legacy.com. 1/3

Admired by colleagues and students, she was an active member of the Institute for Psychoanalytic Training and Research and the New York Freudian Society. A devoted and loving wife, mother, grandmother, aunt, friend, and animal lover, Edith had a brilliant mind, adored her work, and was passionate about helping people. Survived by stepdaughter Shelley Goodman Morofsky, stepson Robert Goodman Kahn (and wife Karen), and daughter-in-law Antonia Goodman. Predeceased by her beloved husband Sol Goodman, stepson Stephen Goodman, son-in- law Allan Morofsky, and brothers Daniel and Robert Schwartz. A memorial service is planned, details on legacy.com. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHWARTZ GOODMAN, EDITH
